main event: Two civilian observers reported sighting a bright light approximately 40 ft in diameter traveling horizontally at a high rate of speed on March 15, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 10 seconds before disappearing., The object was first seen at an elevation of 45 degrees and traveled horizontally at an estimated speed of 1,000 mph., The sighting was reported to be of an unidentified aerial phenomenon., Observations were made from a ship at coordinates 41-05N, 71-30W., The object left a trail or exhaust but produced no sound.
witness description: civilian observers on board a ship
